isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SPICER 15-1/2 INCH (394 MM) SOLO™ CLUTCH - REMOVE - INSPECTION OF FLYWHEEL AND FLYWHEEL HOUSING

svcproc.title: INSPECTION OF FLYWHEEL AND FLYWHEEL HOUSING

important.para: Failure to perform the following steps can result in low clutch mileage due to disc/damper failure. Before proceeding, remove the pilot bearing from the flywheel.

step1.para: Inspect the flywheel for heat checks or warping.
Inspect the mating surfaces of the flywheel housing and transmission clutch housing ( Figure 3). Any appreciable wear on either surface can cause misalignment.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Inspect Mating Surfaces of Flywheel Housing and Transmission Clutch Housing

step1.para: Secure a dial indicator to the flywheel housing with the gauge finger near the outer edge of the flywheel ( Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Secure Dial Indicator to Flywheel Housing

step1.para: Rotate the flywheel 1 revolution noting the high and low spots. The difference between high and low spots should not exceed .008 inch.
Move the gauge finger to the pilot bearing bore surface ( Figure 5).

figure.caption: Figure 5. Move Gauge Finger to Pilot Bearing Bore Surface

step1.para: Rotate the flywheel 1 revolution. Runout should not exceed .005 inch.
Secure the dial indicator to the crankshaft with the gauge finger against the flywheel housing pilot area ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Secure Dial Indicator to Crankshaft

step1.para: Rotate the flywheel 1 revolution. The difference between high and low spots should not exceed .008 inch.
Secure the dial indicator to the flywheel outer diameter with the gauge finger against the flywheel housing mounting face ( Figure 7).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Secure Dial Indicator to Flywheel Outer Diameter

step1.para: Rotate the flywheel 1 revolution. The difference between high and low spots should not exceed .008 inch.
